classes.title: RADI432
classes.subtitle: Concepts and Perspectives in Radiologic Science.  1 Credit.
classes.description: This overview of radiologic science encompasses patient care, imaging modalities for diagnosis and treatment, radiation protection, health care trends, and information management systems. Pass/Fail course.Grading status: Pass/Fail.

classes.title: RADI442
classes.subtitle: Introduction to Radiologic Science.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This overview of radiologic science encompasses patient care, imaging modalities for diagnosis and treatment, radiation protection, health care trends, and information management systems. Pass/Fail course.Grading status: Pass/Fail.

classes.title: RADI442
classes.subtitle: Introduction to Radiologic Science.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Majors only. Lectures, discussions, demonstrations, and laboratory exercises are combined to introduce topics including patient assessment, image characteristics, radiation protection, positioning skills, medical terminology, and the role of imaging sciences in health care.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI461
classes.subtitle: Radiography I.  4 Credits.
classes.description: Majors only. Lectures, discussions, demonstrations, and laboratory exercises are combined to introduce topics including patient assessment, image characteristics, radiation protection, positioning skills, medical terminology, and the role of imaging sciences in health care.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI461
classes.subtitle: Radiography I.  4 Credits.
classes.description: Prepares students for standard radiography of upper extremities, lower extremities, axial skeleton, bony thorax, chest, abdomen, and the basic skull, considering pathologies and gross, radiographic, and cross-sectional anatomy. Three lecture hours and two laboratory hours.Requisites: Prerequisites, AHSC�440 and RADI�442.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI462
classes.subtitle: Radiographic Imaging I.  4 Credits.
classes.description: Prepares students for standard radiography of upper extremities, lower extremities, axial skeleton, bony thorax, chest, abdomen, and the basic skull, considering pathologies and gross, radiographic, and cross-sectional anatomy. Three lecture hours and two laboratory hours.Requisites: Prerequisites, AHSC�440 and RADI�442.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI462
classes.subtitle: Radiographic Imaging I.  4 Credits.
classes.description: An overview of radiographic imaging methods examining the imaging process as a sequence of events from x ray production through hard copy processing. The imaging equipment is discussed in terms of function, influence on the image, the impact of alteration on image characteristics, and compensation techniques for changes in the sequence. Three lecture hours and two laboratory hours.Requisites: Prerequisites, AHSC�440 and RADI�442.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI463
classes.subtitle: Clinical Education I.  4 Credits.
classes.description: An overview of radiographic imaging methods examining the imaging process as a sequence of events from x ray production through hard copy processing. The imaging equipment is discussed in terms of function, influence on the image, the impact of alteration on image characteristics, and compensation techniques for changes in the sequence. Three lecture hours and two laboratory hours.Requisites: Prerequisites, AHSC�440 and RADI�442.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI463
classes.subtitle: Clinical Education I.  4 Credits.
classes.description: A clinical course focusing on the application and evaluation of radiography in the hospital setting. With supervision, the student develops clinical skills through observation and participation in radiographic procedures. Twenty practicum hours.Requisites: Prerequisites, AHSC�440 and RADI�442.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI465
classes.subtitle: FOUNDATIONS IN RAD THER.  4 Credits.
classes.description: A clinical course focusing on the application and evaluation of radiography in the hospital setting. With supervision, the student develops clinical skills through observation and participation in radiographic procedures. Twenty practicum hours.Requisites: Prerequisites, AHSC�440 and RADI�442.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI465
classes.subtitle: FOUNDATIONS IN RAD THER.  4 Credits.

classes.title: RADI471
classes.subtitle: Radiography II.  3 Credits.

classes.title: RADI471
classes.subtitle: Radiography II.  3 Credits.
classes.description: The course content prepares students for standard radiography of cranial bones, facial bones, and special cranial projections. Contrast studies include gastrointestinal, urinary, biliary, cardiovascular, and other special procedures. The course includes pathologies, and gross, radiographic, and cross-sectional anatomy. Two lecture hours and two laboratory hours.Requisites: Prerequisite, RADI�461.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI472
classes.subtitle: Radiographic Imaging II.  4 Credits.
classes.description: The course content prepares students for standard radiography of cranial bones, facial bones, and special cranial projections. Contrast studies include gastrointestinal, urinary, biliary, cardiovascular, and other special procedures. The course includes pathologies, and gross, radiographic, and cross-sectional anatomy. Two lecture hours and two laboratory hours.Requisites: Prerequisite, RADI�461.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI472
classes.subtitle: Radiographic Imaging II.  4 Credits.
classes.description: A detailed study of specific elements of the radiographic process, with an emphasis on the interrelationships of the radiographic parameters, refinement of image analysis and problem-solving skills, and quality control testing for evaluating the performance of the radiographic equipment and accessories. Three lecture hours and two laboratory hours.Requisites: Prerequisite, RADI�462.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI473
classes.subtitle: Clinical Education II.  4 Credits.
classes.description: A detailed study of specific elements of the radiographic process, with an emphasis on the interrelationships of the radiographic parameters, refinement of image analysis and problem-solving skills, and quality control testing for evaluating the performance of the radiographic equipment and accessories. Three lecture hours and two laboratory hours.Requisites: Prerequisite, RADI�462.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI473
classes.subtitle: Clinical Education II.  4 Credits.
classes.description: A continuation of RADI�463 with emphasis on the application and evaluation of more complex radiographic studies. Twenty practicum hours.Requisites: Prerequisite, RADI�463.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI574
classes.subtitle: Clinical  Education III.  3 Credits.
classes.description: A continuation of RADI�463 with emphasis on the application and evaluation of more complex radiographic studies. Twenty practicum hours.Requisites: Prerequisite, RADI�463.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI574
classes.subtitle: Clinical  Education III.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Under general supervision, the student will function at an increased level of responsibility in general diagnostic radiography in a variety of clinical settings outside of the university setting.Requisites: Prerequisite, RADI�473.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI575
classes.subtitle: Clinical Education IV.  5 Credits.
classes.description: Under general supervision, the student will function at an increased level of responsibility in general diagnostic radiography in a variety of clinical settings outside of the university setting.Requisites: Prerequisite, RADI�473.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI575
classes.subtitle: Clinical Education IV.  5 Credits.
classes.description: Under general supervision, the student will function at an increased level of responsibility in radiography in clinical settings outside of the university setting. The course includes a comprehensive review examination and case studies.Requisites: Prerequisite, RADI�574.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI583
classes.subtitle: Clinical Education V.  4 Credits.
classes.description: Under general supervision, the student will function at an increased level of responsibility in radiography in clinical settings outside of the university setting. The course includes a comprehensive review examination and case studies.Requisites: Prerequisite, RADI�574.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI583
classes.subtitle: Clinical Education V.  4 Credits.
classes.description: A clinical course utilizing contract learning to provide students an opportunity to gain additional competency in specialized areas of radiology. Twenty-four education and independent study hours.Requisites: Prerequisites, RADI�574 and 575.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI584
classes.subtitle: Clinical Education VI.  6 Credits.
classes.description: A clinical course utilizing contract learning to provide students an opportunity to gain additional competency in specialized areas of radiology. Twenty-four education and independent study hours.Requisites: Prerequisites, RADI�574 and 575.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI584
classes.subtitle: Clinical Education VI.  6 Credits.
classes.description: This course is a continuation of RADI�583 using learning contracts to allow students to explore and gain additional expertise in various areas of radiology. Twenty-four clinical hours.Requisites: Prerequisite, RADI�583.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI585
classes.subtitle: Radiologic Health Physics.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course is a continuation of RADI�583 using learning contracts to allow students to explore and gain additional expertise in various areas of radiology. Twenty-four clinical hours.Requisites: Prerequisite, RADI�583.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI585
classes.subtitle: Radiologic Health Physics.  3 Credits.
classes.description: A course in the physics of diagnostic radiology, including radiation effects on tissue, radiation detection and measurement, protection methods and techniques, and environmental radiation issues. Three lecture hours.Requisites: Prerequisite, RADI�472; permission of the instructor for students lacking the prerequisite.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI586
classes.subtitle: Research in Radiologic Science I.  1 Credit.
classes.description: A course in the physics of diagnostic radiology, including radiation effects on tissue, radiation detection and measurement, protection methods and techniques, and environmental radiation issues. Three lecture hours.Requisites: Prerequisite, RADI�472; permission of the instructor for students lacking the prerequisite.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI586
classes.subtitle: Research in Radiologic Science I.  1 Credit.
classes.description: Majors only. The major part of the course is devoted to an investigative project on a discipline-related topic of student interest. Select issues affecting professional affairs of radiologic technologists are also included.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI591
classes.subtitle: Practicum in Radiologic Science.  4 Credits.
classes.description: Majors only. The major part of the course is devoted to an investigative project on a discipline-related topic of student interest. Select issues affecting professional affairs of radiologic technologists are also included.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI591
classes.subtitle: Practicum in Radiologic Science.  4 Credits.
classes.description: This course offers an elective clinical experience in an area of student interest.Requisites: Prerequisite, RADI�584.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI594
classes.subtitle: Professional Communications and Interactions.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course offers an elective clinical experience in an area of student interest.Requisites: Prerequisite, RADI�584.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI594
classes.subtitle: Professional Communications and Interactions.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Majors only. This course provides for a brief cognitive and skills approach to communication skills, the teaching/learning process, and methods and materials of instruction and delivery. Three lecture/discussion hours per week.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI597
classes.subtitle: Leadership in Radiologic Science.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Majors only. This course provides for a brief cognitive and skills approach to communication skills, the teaching/learning process, and methods and materials of instruction and delivery. Three lecture/discussion hours per week.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI597
classes.subtitle: Leadership in Radiologic Science.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Majors only. In this course students will analyze the theoretical literature on leadership and apply that knowledge in the analysis of various radiology environment situations. Three lecture hours.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI660
classes.subtitle: Pathophysiology.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Majors only. In this course students will analyze the theoretical literature on leadership and apply that knowledge in the analysis of various radiology environment situations. Three lecture hours.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI660
classes.subtitle: Pathophysiology.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Majors only. This course will enhance and integrate the student's knowledge of anatomy, physiology, and pathology related to all human body systems. Emphasis will be placed on understanding how structure, function, and disease are interrelated. Three lecture hours per week.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI662
classes.subtitle: Instrument and Imaging Methods.  4 Credits.
classes.description: Majors only. This course will enhance and integrate the student's knowledge of anatomy, physiology, and pathology related to all human body systems. Emphasis will be placed on understanding how structure, function, and disease are interrelated. Three lecture hours per week.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI662
classes.subtitle: Instrument and Imaging Methods.  4 Credits.

classes.title: RADI670
classes.subtitle: Integrated Principles of Radiographic Analysis.  4 Credits.

classes.title: RADI670
classes.subtitle: Integrated Principles of Radiographic Analysis.  4 Credits.
classes.description: This course involves students in situational problem solving and radiographic analysis. Integration of concepts and knowledge of anatomy, pathology, procedures, patient care, and imaging principles are emphasized. Four lecture hours.Requisites: Prerequisite, RADI�660.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI672
classes.subtitle: Radiographic Imaging II.  4 Credits.
classes.description: This course involves students in situational problem solving and radiographic analysis. Integration of concepts and knowledge of anatomy, pathology, procedures, patient care, and imaging principles are emphasized. Four lecture hours.Requisites: Prerequisite, RADI�660.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI672
classes.subtitle: Radiographic Imaging II.  4 Credits.
classes.description: A detailed study of specific elements of the radiographic process, with an emphasis on the interrelationships of the radiographic parameters, refinement of image analysis and problem-solving skills, and quality. Three lectures hours and two laboratory hours.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI681
classes.subtitle: Trends in Medical Imaging Practices Issues in the Radiology Practice Environment.  3 Credits.
classes.description: A detailed study of specific elements of the radiographic process, with an emphasis on the interrelationships of the radiographic parameters, refinement of image analysis and problem-solving skills, and quality. Three lectures hours and two laboratory hours.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI681
classes.subtitle: Trends in Medical Imaging Practices Issues in the Radiology Practice Environment.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Majors only. The course covers issues related to health care systems, medicolegal ethics, and practice and quality assurance. Three lecture hours per week.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI686
classes.subtitle: Research in Radiologic Science II.  2 Credits.
classes.description: Majors only. The course covers issues related to health care systems, medicolegal ethics, and practice and quality assurance. Three lecture hours per week.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI686
classes.subtitle: Research in Radiologic Science II.  2 Credits.
classes.description: Majors only. Students complete a research project involving a major clinical or policy issue in radiologic science. This course is an expansion of the fall semester research culminating in both a paper and presentation.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI694
classes.subtitle: Clinical Decisions in Radiology.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Majors only. Students complete a research project involving a major clinical or policy issue in radiologic science. This course is an expansion of the fall semester research culminating in both a paper and presentation.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: RADI694
classes.subtitle: Clinical Decisions in Radiology.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Majors only. This course involves the pharmacology of common radiology medications and advanced patient assessment techniques. With the additional knowledge and skills, students can make informed decisions regarding patient care. Three lecture hours.Grading status: Letter grade.
